info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Seven Springs, or 8 miles east of Connellsville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Connellsville, Seven Springs, Laurel Mountain, Donegal, Champion, Mill Run, Indian Head, Normalville, Jones Mills, Laurel Mountain State Park, and Acme. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 89 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania.
